summary.title: Brew & Bloom Coffee Co.
summary.description: The Brew & Bloom Coffee Co. Ordering Application can be decomposed into the following key components and their interactions, forming the basis for identifying trust boundaries and data flows.

data.name: User
data.description: Customer, Barista, Manager, Admin all uses the same login system

data.name: Web Application Server
data.description: Handles Authentication, Orders, Menu, Reports, Payments

data.name: Web Application Server
data.description: Handles: Manager authentication, Authorization checks, Sales report generation, Formatting data

threats.title: T-017 - Customer to Staff Privilege Escalation
threats.description: A customer could exploit a vulnerability to gain unauthorized access to Barista, Manager, or Administrator functionalities.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: T-007 - Application Code/Configuration Tampering
threats.description: Malicious modification of the applicationâ€™s source code, server configurations, or environment variables could introduce backdoors or disable security features.
threats.mitigation: Defences include providing enforcement of behavioral workflow and anti-automation

threats.title: T-009 - Staff Action Repudiation
threats.description: Staff members (Barista, Manager, Administrator) could deny performing actions if audit logs are insufficient, not immutable, or can be tampered with.

threats.title: T-012 - Application Code and Configuration Disclosure
threats.description: Exposure of source code, server configurations, environment variables, or API keys.
threats.mitigation: Mitigation or prevention such as providing backoff, resource management and avoiding forced deadlock

threats.title: T-014 - Web Application Server DoS
threats.description: An attacker could flood the Web Application Server with excessive requests, making it unavailable.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: T-017 - Barista/Manager to Administrator Privilege Escalation
threats.description: A Barista or Manager could exploit a vulnerability to gain Administrator privileges.
threats.mitigation: Defences include providing enforcement of behavioral workflow and anti-automation

data.name: MongoDB Database
data.description: Stores: Sales records, Orders, Transaction history

threats.title: T-006 - Sales Report Tampering
threats.description: Unauthorized individuals could alter sales data in the MongoDB Database, leading to falsified reports.
threats.mitigation: Defences include providing enforcement of behavioral workflow and anti-automation

threats.title: T-009 - Staff Action Repudiation
threats.description: Staff members (Barista, Manager, Administrator) could deny performing actions if audit logs are insufficient, not immutable, or can be tampered with.

threats.title: T-013 - Sales Data Disclosure
threats.description: Unauthorized access to sales reports or underlying aggregated sales data.
threats.mitigation: Mitigation or prevention such as providing backoff, resource management and avoiding forced deadlock

threats.title: T-015 - MongoDB Database DoS
threats.description: Malicious or poorly optimized queries could overload the database, making it unresponsive.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

data.name: Manager
data.description: Performs: Login, Report request, Report viewing

threats.title: T-002 - Staff Account Spoofing
threats.description:
An attacker could impersonate staff to manipulate order statuses,
access sales reports, or modify menu items and application
configurations.
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A
